                    ### Question
                    Which of the following is the best-known metabolic function of the lung

                    ### Options
                    opa. Inactivation of serotonin
opb. Conversion of angiotensin–I to angiotensin–II
opc. Inactivation of bradykinin
opd. Metabolism of basic drugs by cytochrome P–450 system

### Enhanced Information (For Contextual Support):
The best-known metabolic function of the lung is the conversion of angiotensin-I to angiotensin-II. This process is facilitated by the presence of angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) in the lungs, which is a well-established fact in medical physiology. While the lung does participate in the inactivation of bradykinin and serotonin, these functions are not as prominently recognized as the conversion of angiotensin-I to angiotensin-II. The metabolism of basic drugs by the cytochrome P-450 system is primarily a function of the liver, not the lung. Therefore, the conversion of angiotensin-I to angiotensin-II is the most significant and well-known metabolic function of the lung.
